t: Genesis 36
Esau’s Family
These*p are the family records of Esau (that is, Edom).
Esau took his wives from the Canaanite women: Adah daughter of Elon the Hethite, Oholibamah daughter of Anah and granddaughter of Zibeon the Hivite,
and Basemath daughter of Ishmael and sister of Nebaioth.
Adah bore Eliphaz to Esau, Basemath bore Reuel,
and Oholibamah bore Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. These were Esau’s sons, who were born to him in the land of Canaan.

Esau*p took his wives, sons, daughters, and all the people of his household, as well as his herds, all his livestock, and all the property he had acquired in Canaan; he went to a land away from his brother Jacob.
For their possessions were too many for them to live together, and because of their herds, the land where they stayed could not support them.
So Esau (that is, Edom) lived in the mountains of Seir.
These*p are the family records of Esau, father of the Edomites in the mountains of Seir.
These*ln are the names of Esau’s sons: Eliphaz*ln son of Esau’s wife Adah, and*ln Reuel son of Esau’s wife Basemath.
The*ln sons of Eliphaz were Teman,*ln Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.
Timna,*ln a concubine of Esau’s son Eliphaz, bore*ln Amalek to Eliphaz. These*ln are the sons of Esau’s wife Adah.
These*ln are Reuel’s sons: Nahath,*ln Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. These*ln are the sons of Esau’s wife Basemath.
These*ln are the sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah daughter*ln of Anah and granddaughter of Zibeon: She*ln bore Jeush, Jalam, and Korah to Edom.
These*ln are the chiefs among Esau’s sons: the*ln sons of Eliphaz, Esau’s firstborn: chief*ln Teman, chief Omar, chief Zepho, chief Kenaz,
chief*ln Korah, chief Gatam, and chief Amalek. These*ln are the chiefs descended from Eliphaz in*ln the land of Edom. These*ln are the sons of Adah.

These*ln are the sons of Reuel, Esau’s son: chief*ln Nahath, chief Zerah, chief Shammah, and chief Mizzah. These*ln are the chiefs descended from Reuel in*ln the land of Edom. These*ln are the sons of Esau’s wife Basemath.
These*ln are the sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah: chief*ln Jeush, chief Jalam, and chief Korah. These*ln are the chiefs descended from Esau’s wife Oholibamah daughter*ln of Anah.
These*ln are the sons of Esau (that is, Edom), and*ln these are their chiefs.
Seir’s Family
These*ln are the sons of Seir the Horite, the*ln inhabitants of the land: Lotan,*ln Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
Dishon,*ln Ezer, and Dishan. These*ln are the chiefs among the Horites, the*ln sons of Seir, in the land of Edom.
The*ln sons of Lotan were Hori and Heman. Timna*ln was Lotan’s sister.
These*ln are Shobal’s sons: Alvan,*ln Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
These*ln are Zibeon’s sons: Aiah and Anah. This*ln was the Anah who found the hot springs in the wilderness while*ln he was pasturing the donkeys of his father Zibeon.
These*ln are the children of Anah: Dishon*ln and Oholibamah daughter of Anah.
These*ln are Dishon’s sons: Hemdan,*ln Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
These*ln are Ezer’s sons: Bilhan,*ln Zaavan, and Akan.
These*ln are Dishan’s sons: Uz and Aran.
These*ln are the chiefs among the Horites: chief*ln Lotan, chief Shobal, chief Zibeon, chief Anah,
chief*ln Dishon, chief Ezer, and chief Dishan. These*ln are the chiefs among the Horites, clan*ln by clan, in the land of Seir.
Rulers of Edom
These*ln are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before*ln any king reigned over the Israelites:
Bela*ln son of Beor reigned in Edom; the*ln name of his city was Dinhabah.
When*ln Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah reigned in his place.
When*ln Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
When*ln Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad reigned in his place. He*ln defeated Midian in the field of Moab; the*ln name of his city was Avith.
When*ln Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah reigned in his place.
When*ln Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the Euphrates River reigned in his place.
When*ln Shaul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor reigned in his place.
When*ln Baal-hanan son of Achbor died, Hadar reigned in his place. His*ln city was Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter*ln of Matred daughter of Me-zahab.
These*ln are the names of Esau’s chiefs, according*ln to their families and their localities, by*ln their names: chief*ln Timna, chief Alvah, chief Jetheth,
chief*ln Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,
chief*ln Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,
chief*ln Magdiel, and chief Iram. These*ln are Edom’s chiefs, according*ln to their settlements in the land they possessed. Esau*ln was father of the Edomites.
